description: Denmark is reopening its previously closed schools for pupils from pre-school through fifth grades and from classes for pupils with special needs. Before- and after-school care (for pupils up to the fifth grade) will open at the same time. Older pupils are continuously taught digitally at home. UPDATE: Schools reopen for pupils from pre-school through fifth grades and for classes for pupils with special needs from all grade. Before- and after-school care (for pupils up to the fifth grade) will open at the same time. Exceptions e.g. for health concerns apply.

description: The government of Denmark is enforcing a restriction of external borders: Denmark closed its borders to all but Danish citizens, individuals with Danish work or residency permits, and those the Danish government determines have a critical purpose of travel after March 14. The closures will be in effect until April 13
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On April 6, the Danish government announced an extension of the border closures imposed on March 14 to May 10. The Danish borders are closed to all but Danish citizens, individuals with Danish work or residency permits, and those the Danish government determines have a critical purpose of travel (e.g. someone commissioned to provide goods or services in Denmark)
 UPDATE: The original external border restriction was set to last until April 13, it has been extended to May 10.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On May 6, the Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen announced an extension of the border closures imposed on March 14 that was set to last until May 10. An end date has not been set this time, but the borders would not open until “at least” June 1.

The Danish borders are closed to all but Danish citizens, individuals with Danish work or residency permits, and those the Danish government determines have a critical purpose of travel (e.g. someone commissioned to provide goods or services in Denmark) UPDATE: The external border closure was set to last until May 10, but has been extended with an unknown end date. An update from the government is due by June 1 at the latest.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On the 29 May, the Danish Prime Minister announced that border restrictions will be lifted from June 15 for tourists from Germany, Iceland and Norway that have booked a stay of minimum six nights outside of Copenhagen and Frederiksberg. 

The Danish borders remain closed to all but these groups, Danish citizens, individuals with Danish work or residency permits, and those the Danish government determines have a critical purpose of travel
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban

description:
On the 29 May, the Danish Prime Minister announced that the external border restrictions in place since March 14 will be lifted from June 15 for tourists from Germany, Iceland and Norway who can show that they have booked a stay of at least six nights outside of Copenhagen and Frederiksberg.

The Danish borders will remain closed to all but tourists from these countries, Danish citizens, individuals with Danish work or residency permits, and those the Danish government determines have a critical purpose of travel.

description: Several municipalities in Denmark invest heavily in improving cycling paths while discouraging the use of public transport to slow the spread of the virus.
type_text: The policy is more intended as a recommendation not to use public transport. There is an economic factor to the policy regarding the government's investment in cycle paths, which perhaps makes it an 'economic' policy. Thus, I'm correcting the policy to 'other'.

description: Denmark is ordering home quarantine for all infected people that have no or mild symptoms and are not considered particularly vulnerable are placed with daily contact from health professionals. Anybody that has been in close contact with someone who is known to be infected by SARS-CoV-2 is placed in home quarantine as well. Quarantine in those cases is enforced for 14 days. The policy was announced on 29 February 2020.

description: Denmark is enforcing a restriction of mass gatherings after march 11: it is recommending to cancel events with more than 100 participants.

Denmark is enforcing a restriction of mass gatherings:  It became illegal to assemble more than ten people in public after march 18. UPDATE: Now the number of people allowed in public space are only 10, and now it's not volunatry anymore but enforced with fines

Denmark is lowering the maximum number of people allowed to assemble, from 100 to 50, in 17 municipalities of the Copenhagen region, along with Odense municipality. This is to combat the recent rising transmission rate of COVID-19 in these places.
